attributes.action: Call for Right to Appeal/Reverse DVSA Examiner’s Decisions on ALL Driving Tests
attributes.additional_details: Reform Road Traffic Act 1988 Section 133 appeal questionable decisions by DVSA Examiners on all Driving Tests. The Right to Appeal is an integral part of the UK constitution derived from Common Law/Bill of Rights 1689. A new law & full powers for tribunals to address unresolved complaints, failures, errors & reverse decisions with right for candidates to call for examiners/witnesses to appear. Due to Covid-19, ADIs/PDIs/Trainers face forced removal from DVSA registers or to return their license
attributes.background: Currently, if a driving test candidate challenges a questionable decision by a Driver & Vehicle Standards Agency Examiner on Practical Driving Tests/ADI Tests in cars/lorries etc, the DVSA won’t reverse the decision. If an appeal is successful only a retest under the Road Traffic Act 1988 is allowed
